wikipedia_page.main: Edward Hugh Simpson CB (10 December 1922 – 5 February 2019) was a British codebreaker, statistician and civil servant. He was best known for describing Simpson's paradox along with Udny Yule.

* Yule–Simpson effect (a.k.a. Simpson's paradox) – Edward H. Simpson and Udny Yule

The Simpson index was introduced in 1949 by Edward H. Simpson to measure the degree of concentration when individuals are classified into types. The same index was rediscovered by Orris C. Herfindahl in 1950.Herfindahl, O. C. (1950) Concentration in the U.S. Steel Industry. Unpublished doctoral dissertation, Columbia University. The square root of the index had already been introduced in 1945 by the economist Albert O. Hirschman.Hirschman, A. O. (1945) National power and the structure of foreign trade. Berkeley. As a result, the same measure is usually known as the Simpson index in ecology, and as the Herfindahl index or the Herfindahl–Hirschman index (HHI) in economics.
